snippet: The N.F.L. and the players’ union met Monday for the first time to discuss the New Orleans Saints’ bounty system and the players the league said its investigation showed were involved.
abstract: NFL Roundup; Representatives of the NFL and the players union meet for the first time to discuss the New Orleans Saints bounty system and the 22 to 27 players the league said its investigation showed were involved; NFL has said it wants the union’s executive director DeMaurice Smith to make a recommendation about what discipline he thinks is appropriate for the players; other NFL news noted.

byline.original: By JUDY BATTISTA and ZACH SCHONBRUN

lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. and the players’ union met Monday for the first time to discuss the New Orleans Saints’ bounty system and the players the league said its investigation showed were involved.

headline.main: Suggestions by Union in Bounty Case Are Unlikely
headline.print_headline: Suggestions By Union In Bounty Case Are Unlikely
